title: Feed for Thought: How to Successfully Wean Beef Calves

tasks.task: Put calves into a weaning area.
subtasks: Identify a suitable area for calves.
Install a creep gate.
Allow calves access to supplemental feed.
Provide high protein feed for calves.
Choose alfalfa with at least 20% protein.
Select alfalfa with high relative feed quality.
Use highly digestible forage for calves.

subtasks: Visit pioneer.com.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Ascertain a feeding strategy for weaned calves.
subtasks: Ensure calves have access to supplemental feed.
Verify the protein content of the feed.
Check relative feed quality of forages.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Choose appropriate alfalfa for calves.
subtasks: Select 20% protein content.
Confirm high relative feed quality.
Use easily digestible fiber.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Find a weaning location away from mother cows.
subtasks: Locate a separate area for calves.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Position creep gates between calf and adult areas.
subtasks: Set up gate at entry point.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Attend to social needs of weaned calves.
subtasks: Ensure calves interact with peers.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Adjust feeding plan after weaning.
subtasks: Monitor calves' eating habits.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Increase feed volume after weaning.
subtasks: Add more supplements as needed.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Stay updated on agronomy tips.
subtasks: Regularly check pioneer.com.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Engage with Pioneer's online community.
subtasks: Follow Pioneer on multiple platforms.
